dimensions.title: Security
dimensions.note: How well does the product reduce attack surface and user exposure by default?
dimensions.scopeNote: Focuses on technical resistance to compromise. Does not include manageability, policy enforcement, or vendor support—those are evaluated under Enterprise Readiness.

questions.title: Component Isolation
questions.description: Modular or third-party components are isolated from the core runtime and each other.

questions.title: Least Privilege & Permissions
questions.description: The system enforces least-privilege access for components, users, and integrations.

questions.title: Secure Update & Patch Mechanism
questions.description: Security updates are authenticated, timely, and resistant to rollback or tampering.

questions.title: Exploit & Misuse Resistance
questions.description: The system includes layered defenses against common exploitation or misuse patterns.

dimensions.title: Reliability
dimensions.note: Does the product behave predictably across updates and real-world usage?
dimensions.scopeNote: Measures continued operation under failure conditions. Does not include raw speed or resource consumption—those are evaluated under Performance.

questions.title: Fault Tolerance
questions.description: The system continues to operate acceptably when components fail or misbehave.

questions.title: Recoverability
questions.description: The system can be restored to a correct state within predictable time bounds.

questions.title: Stability Under Load
questions.description: The system maintains stability under expected and peak operational conditions.

dimensions.title: Performance Efficiency
dimensions.note: How efficiently does the product use system and network resources under normal workloads?
dimensions.scopeNote: Evaluates resource efficiency and predictable behavior under load. Does not include fault recovery or continued operation during failures—those are evaluated under Reliability.

questions.title: Resource Efficiency
questions.description: The system uses CPU, memory, storage, and network resources proportionately to its function.

questions.title: Performance Predictability
questions.description: System performance is consistent and degrades gracefully under stress.

dimensions.title: Usability
dimensions.note: How intuitive is the experience for users with varying technical maturity?
dimensions.scopeNote: Assesses user comprehension and error recovery. Does not include whether the system has all needed features—that's evaluated under Functional Suitability.

questions.title: Safe & Understandable Interaction
questions.description: Users can understand system actions, permissions, and consequences without undue effort.

questions.title: Error Prevention & Recovery
questions.description: The system helps users avoid errors and recover safely when errors occur.

dimensions.title: Compatibility
dimensions.note: How well does the product work with modern websites, SaaS tools, and extensions?
dimensions.scopeNote: Addresses integration with external systems and peaceful co-existence in shared environments. Does not include cross-platform deployment flexibility—that's evaluated under Portability.

questions.title: Interoperability
questions.description: The system interoperates cleanly with external systems via stable, documented interfaces.

questions.title: Co-Existence
questions.description: The system operates without degrading or being degraded by other systems in the same environment.

dimensions.title: Maintainability
dimensions.note: How easy is it for IT to configure, update, and support at scale?
dimensions.scopeNote: Covers diagnosability and safe updates. Does not include runtime fault tolerance—that's evaluated under Reliability.

questions.title: Modularity & Separation of Concerns
questions.description: The system is structured to allow components to be changed with minimal side effects.

questions.title: Diagnosability & Observability
questions.description: Failures and abnormal behaviors can be detected, diagnosed, and understood.

questions.title: Change Safety
questions.description: Updates and configuration changes can be applied with low risk of regression.

dimensions.title: Portability
dimensions.note: How consistently does the product behave across platforms and environments?
dimensions.scopeNote: Concerns the system's ability to move across platforms and be replaced. Does not include runtime integration with other systems—that's evaluated under Compatibility.

questions.title: Environment Independence
questions.description: The system can operate across supported environments with minimal modification.

questions.title: Replaceability
questions.description: The system can be replaced or removed without excessive disruption.

dimensions.title: Functional Suitability
dimensions.note: Does the product align with core business browsing needs without excess or gaps?
dimensions.scopeNote: Evaluates whether the system has the right features and they work correctly. Does not include user experience or learnability—those are evaluated under Usability.

questions.title: Functional Completeness
questions.description: The system provides all essential capabilities required for its intended purpose.

questions.title: Functional Correctness
questions.description: The system's functions produce correct and expected results.

dimensions.title: Enterprise Readiness
dimensions.note: Is the product designed with enterprise governance, compliance, and support expectations in mind?
dimensions.scopeNote: Evaluates organizational deployment concerns: policy control, fleet management, and vendor accountability. Does not include technical security mechanisms—those are evaluated under Security.

questions.title: Policy & Fleet Management
questions.description: The system supports centralized configuration, policy enforcement, and fleet-wide management appropriate for enterprise scale.

questions.title: Compliance & Audit Support
questions.description: The system provides logging, reporting, and controls that support regulatory compliance and security audits.

levels.label: Absent
levels.description: Critical gaps that may disqualify for enterprise use

levels.label: Adequate
levels.description: Meets baseline requirements with room for improvement

levels.label: Strong
levels.description: Above-average capability meeting enterprise requirements well

levels.label: Hardened
levels.description: Exceptional capability with proactive, defense-in-depth approach

scale.overall_note: Given the intended deployment context, what is the overall maturity/risk posture and the operational effort required to keep behavior predictable at scale?
